data.description: Which schools may reopen in which county. This WordPress data table provides two data sources. One for the counties

data.title: County regions
data.name: countyregions
data.description:
Used for Regional Stay at Home Order (RSHO). Assignments of RSHO to California counties.

Used to be a spreadsheet, but now the data lives as JSON in github.

datasets.name: countyregions
datasets.label: County regions
datasets.data_pipeline: Wordpress table data > JSON

data.title: County status
data.name: countystatus
data.description: County Tier Status. Is updated weekly or as needed. A FaaS service runs with the script posted in "Edit Data Source" This script pulls data from Snowflake.
tags: Blueprint for a Safer Economy Tiers

datasets.name: countystatus
datasets.label: County status
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.title: Summary - statewide
data.name: The disparities in our diverse communities are severe
data.intent: Show summary charts that make the main point of the page (if users stopped after seeing just those)
data.description: COVID-19 disproportionately affects California’s low income, Latino, Black, and Pacific Islander communities, as well as essential workers such as those in health care, grocery, and cleaning services.
data.metric:
**R/E case rate, median income case rate, health equity metric**

**Metric value = all %s**
data.data_attributes:
- Case rate of Latino, black + NHPI
- Case rate of median income <40K
- Lowest 25% testing positivity

datasets.name: CasesAndDeathsByDemographic
datasets.label: Summary - statewide
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.title: % Missingness by Race and Ethnicity (R/E)
data.name: Data completeness is critical to addressing inequity: Reporting by race and ethnicitData completeness is critical to addressing inequityy in California
data.intent: “The disparities among race and ethnicity lines are so important and we don’t have the data to describe it”
data.description: We know a lot about the impact of COVID-19 on certain communities, but we can better invest our resources by increasing the collection of race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation and gender identity data. This data collection requires close cooperation with private sector partners, laboratories, and state and county officials. View resources on how to improve reporting.
data.metric:
**% Missing Race/Ethnicity Data** (Testing, Cases and Deaths) – by County 

**Metric value = all %s**
data.data_attributes: Unknown data for Case, Deaths, and Testing

datasets.name: MissingnessData
datasets.label: % Missingness by Race and Ethnicity (R/E)
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.name: COVID-19 impact by race and ethnicity: Cases, deaths and tests rate relative to percentage of population in California
data.intent: See how Latinx is only x% of population and yet y% of cases”
data.data_attributes: - R/E of total cases, deaths, testing

datasets.label: Proportion by Race and Ethnicity (R/E)
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.title: R/E Rate relative to population
data.name: COVID-19 impact by race and ethnicity: Cases, deaths and tests rate per 100K by race and ethnicity group in California
data.intent: “Despite not having complete data, the data we have does show there is a disproportionate impact on certain communities” e.g 6/10,000 Latinos have COVID “More evidence of above.
data.metric:
**Rate** – show the proportion of cases, testing, deaths by gender, age, and R/E in comparison to their percent of the total population 
 
**Metric value = rate by 100K**
data.data_attributes: - % of Cases, deaths and testing of R/E / Population of R/E (\*100,000)

datasets.name: CumulativeStatewideData
datasets.label: R/E Rate relative to population
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.title: Income
data.name: Factors that increase risk of infection and severe illness
data.intent: “This is more than about race”
data.description: Californians in crowded housing or transportation, and with less access to paid leave and other worker protections, have a higher risk of infection of COVID-19. Social determinants of health, such as food insecurity, lack of health insurance, and housing instability can increase the risk of poor outcomes. These social determinants of health are often the result of structural racism.

datasets.label: Income

JSON file

data.title: Equity metric - test positivity
data.name: COVID-19 health equity metric
data.intent: “This is so important that we use this to determine a county’s reopening” (so that everyone is brought along)
data.description: The health equity metric measures the positivity rate in the most disproportionately-impacted communities. These communities are identified in the Healthy Places Index as census tracts that have less healthy community conditions such as low median income, education completeness, and health care access. The Blueprint for a Safer Economy ensures that counties address COVID-19 in all communities. To open further, the health equity metric cannot significantly fall behind overall county positivity rates.
data.metric: Testing positivity in the lowest 25% of the healthy places HE index, by county
data.data_attributes:
- Test positivity rate
- Lowest 25% healthy HE index

datasets.name: HealthEquityData
datasets.label: Equity metric - test positivity
datasets.data_pipeline:
Snowflake > Github > FaaS HttpTrigger > 
JSON file

data.title: Race/Ethnicity list
data.data_attributes:
- Black
- American Indian or Alaska Native (AI/AN)
- Asian American
- Latino
- Multi-Race
- Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander (NHPI)
- White
- Other
- Unknown
data.calculations_or_user_interface_manipulat: A script in covid19 github repository has a string override to adjust data display.

data.title: Vaccination by Groups: Race and Ethnicity
data.name: People with at least one dose of vaccine administered by race and ethnicity in California
data.intent:
The distribution of first vaccine doses by race and ethnicity, age, and gender is shown below. Providing this information is voluntary and not required for vaccination. 

Initially, vaccination was limited to healthcare workers and long-term care residents. Hence the data reflects those populations more than other California residents. Data shows the cumulative total administered and are updated daily.
data.description:
The distribution of first vaccine doses by race and ethnicity, age, and gender is shown below. Providing this information is voluntary and not required for vaccination. 

Initially, vaccination was limited to healthcare workers and long-term care residents. Hence the data reflects those populations more than other California residents. Data shows the cumulative total administered and are updated daily.

datasets.name: vaccines_by_race_ethnicity_california
datasets.label: Vaccines by Race and Ethnicity in California
datasets.data_pipeline: CAIRS > CDPH > Snowflake Marketplace > SQL queries > Cron repo > Azure FaaS trigger requests > Write to covid-static > published to /data folder > Synced to files.covid19.ca.gov files server after 10 minutes  > JSON file > covid19 > Web component fetch request > /src/js/charts-sandbox/chart/*
datasets.metadata: Vaccination by Groups: Race and Ethnicity
